|nationalcaps1 = 13 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 21:20, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 15 March 2014 }} '''Phillip Anthony Bardsley''' (born 28 June 1985) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] and the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland national team]]. Although born in England, Bardsley qualifies for Scotland through his [[Glasgow]]-born father.<ref>[http://sport.stv.tv/football/scottish-premier/rangers/201311-phil-bardsley-called-into-scotland-squad-for-euro-2012-games/ Phil Bardsley called into Scotland squad for Euro 2012 games]</ref>
Bardsley began his career with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] where he made 18 appearances in five seasons at the club. During that time, he was loaned to several clubs, including [[Royal Antwerp F.C.|Royal Antwerp]], [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]], [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] and [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].
He joined [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in January 2008 for an initial fee of £850,000. Bardsley established himself as a regular at the [[Stadium of Light]] under [[Steve Bruce]] and [[Martin O'Neill]] and he won the player of the year award in [[2010–11 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2010–11]]. He lost his place in the team in [[2012–13 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2012–13]] after a falling-out with manager [[Paolo Di Canio]], before returning to the first team under [[Gus Poyet]]. Under Poyet, Bardsley helped Sunderland to avoid relegation in [[2013–14 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2013–14]] and reach the [[2014 Football League Cup Final]], in which they lost 3–1 to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].
After his Sunderland contract expired in June 2014, Bardsley joined [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on a free transfer. He spent three seasons with the club before joining [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in July 2017.
==Early life== Bardsley attended [[Hope High School (Salford)|Hope High School]] in his hometown, Salford, along with former United teammates [[Mark Redshaw]] and [[Mark Howard (defender)|Mark Howard]]. Bardsley started his career with Charlestown Lads Club also with Redshaw before signing for Manchester United.<ref name="Sport Vibe">{{cite web|title=Mark Redshaw – FC Oss |url=http://www.sportsvibe.co.uk/features/football/brits-abroad-11265/mark-redshaw-fc-oss-12492/ |work=Sports Vibe |accessdate=23 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407012507/http://www.sportsvibe.co.uk/features/football/brits-abroad-11265/mark-redshaw-fc-oss-12492/ |archivedate=7 April 2012 }}</ref> He grew up near Manchester United's old training ground, [[The Cliff (training ground)|The Cliff]], and would often go there on his school holidays to see the players train. Prior to his departure for Sunderland, he was the only current player who progressed through all the levels of the academy, starting out at the club at the age of 8.<ref name="Sport Vibe"/>
==Club career==
===Manchester United=== After coming through the club's youth system, Bardsley was a regular in Manchester United's under-17 team from the 2000–01 season, before progressing to the under-19s from the 2002–03 season. He continued in the under-19s in [[2003–04 Manchester United F.C. season|2003–04]], but appeared more frequently in the reserves before making his first-team debut in a 2–0 defeat to [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 3 December 2003 in the fourth round of the [[2003–04 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Baggies bounce Man Utd out|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/3246994.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2015|date=3 December 2003}}</ref> He made a second appearance for the first team in the 3–0 [[FA Cup]] fourth round win over [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] on 25 January 2004, before going on a four-month loan to Manchester United's Belgian feeder club, [[Royal Antwerp F.C.|Royal Antwerp]], on 30 January.<ref>{{cite web|title=Northampton 0–3 Man Utd|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/3403761.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2015|date=25 January 2004}}</ref> He made six appearances for Royal Antwerp, including a 4–0 defeat to [[Club Brugge K.V.|Club Brugge]] on 8 February 2004, in which he was sent off for two bookable offences.<ref>{{cite web |title=Club Brugge K.V. 4–0 R. Antwerp F.C. |url=http://www.rafcmuseum.be/wedstrijdarchief/wedstrijdfiche.php?matchid=1730 |publisher=R.A.F.C.-Museum (Royal Antwerp FC) |accessdate=23 May 2014 }}</ref>
After returning to Manchester United at the end of 2003–04, Bardsley made three appearances on the club's [[2004–05 Manchester United F.C. season|2004–05]] pre-season tour of the United States, playing against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] and [[A.C. Milan|Milan]]. He made another promising start to the [[2005–06 Manchester United F.C. season|2005–06]] season, and an injury to [[Gary Neville]] gave him plenty of opportunities to play between August and November 2005. He was regularly named as a substitute for much of the rest of the season, before going on loan to [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on 16 March 2006. He played six matches and scored an own goal in the first minute of a 1–1 draw at home to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Burnley 1–1 Southampton|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/4842462.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2015|date=28 March 2006}}</ref>
====Loan to Rangers==== Bardsley again made a significant contribution to Manchester United's pre-season programme in [[2006–07 Manchester United F.C. season|2006–07]], but on 16 August, he was sent out on loan again, this time to [[Scottish Premier League]] club [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Rangers sign up Bardsley on loan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/r/rangers/4799891.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2006 |accessdate=14 April 2012 }}</ref> On 9 September 2006, he scored his only goal for Rangers against [[Falkirk F.C.|Falkirk]] with a terrific long-range free kick.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/5325254.stm |title=Rangers 4–0 Falkirk |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 September 2006 |accessdate=24 October 2009 }}</ref> He was sent off against [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Hibernians 2–1 Rangers |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/scot_prem/5345670.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 September 2006 |accessdate=14 April 2012 }}</ref> and therefore missed the [[Old Firm]] match against [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]. On 17 October, it was reported that Bardsley was involved in a training ground disagreement with manager [[Paul Le Guen]] and his future at Rangers appeared to be in doubt.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bardsley axed after boss bust-up |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rangers/6061000.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 October 2006 }}</ref> Indeed, Bardsley never played for Rangers again and returned to Manchester United in December.<ref>{{cite news |title=Old Trafford duo make Ibrox exit |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rangers/6216885.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 December 2006 }}</ref>
====Loan to Aston Villa==== On 8 January 2007, Bardsley joined [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan until the end of the season and played his first [[Premier League]] match against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 20 January.<ref>{{cite web |title=Tactical Formation |work=Football-Lineups.com |url=http://www.football-lineups.com/wiki/_match3473.php |accessdate=3 February 2007 }}</ref> It was announced on 1 May that Bardsley would be returning to Manchester United when his loan deal with Villa ran out as manager [[Martin O'Neill]] did not want to make the move permanent.<ref>{{cite news |title=Phil's United Return |url=http://www.avfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/News/HeadlinesDetail/0,,10265~1019107,00.html |publisher=Aston Villa F.C. |date=1 May 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071006014134/http://www.avfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/News/HeadlinesDetail/0,,10265~1019107,00.html |archivedate=6 October 2007 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
====Loan to Sheffield United==== After playing what would turn out to be his last match for the Manchester United first team against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] in the League Cup on 26 September 2007, it was confirmed on 15 October Bardsley would join [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] on loan until January 2008.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd's Bardsley in Blades loan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sheff_utd/7044929.stm |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=15 October 2007 |accessdate=24 May 2014 }}</ref> He made his full debut for the Blades a few days later in a 1–1 draw with [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] at Bramall Lane. Despite Sheffield United agreeing a deal with Manchester United to sign him permanently,<ref name="Bardsley loan">{{cite news |title=Bardsley Deal Fear |url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/sport/sheffield-united/Bardsley-deal-fear.3645259.jp |work=Sheffield Star |publisher=Johnston Press Digital Publishing |date=7 January 2008 |accessdate=22 January 2008 }}</ref> Bardsley left at the end of his loan deal in January 2008 after playing 16 matches.
===Sunderland=== [[File:Phil Bardsley 2.jpg|thumb|Bardsley for Sunderland in a pre-season friendly against [[York City F.C.|York City]]]] On 22 January 2008, Bardsley joined Sunderland on a three-and-a-half-year contract in a deal worth an initial £850,000, potentially rising to £2 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland complete Bardsley signing |url=http://www.safc.com/news/?page_id=14043 |work=safc.com |publisher=Sunderland AFC |date=22 January 2008 |accessdate=22 January 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080124045034/http://www.safc.com/news/?page_id=14043 |archivedate=24 January 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bardsley makes Sunderland switch|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/7203422.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 May 2014|date=23 January 2008}}</ref> He made his debut in a 2–0 win against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] in the Premier League on 29 January.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 2–0 Birmingham|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7210578.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 May 2014|date=29 January 2008}}</ref> Bardsley played 11 times under [[Roy Keane]] in [[2007–08 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2007–08]] as Sunderland successfully avoided relegation by three points.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keane brings out best in Bardsley|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/7340689.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 May 2014|date=10 April 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Angry Keane prepares to wield axe|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/7381027.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 May 2014|date=5 May 2008}}</ref> On 27 August 2008 Bardsley scored his first goal in English football in a 2–1 victory against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Nottm Forest 1–2 Sunderland (aet) |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/7576515.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2008 |accessdate=3 November 2009 |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie}}</ref> Bardsley lost out to [[Pascal Chimbonda]] during the first half of the [[2008–09 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2008–09]] campaign before regaining his place in the team in November 2008.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bardsley determined to keep place|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/7742062.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 May 2014|date=21 November 2008}}</ref> He retained his place under [[Ricky Sbragia]], playing in total 33 times in 2008–09 as Sunderland survived relegation on the final day of the season.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sanghera|first=Mandeep|title=Sunderland 2–3 Chelsea|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8048317.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 May 2014|date=24 May 2009}}</ref><ref name="2008/09"/>
[[File:Phil Bardsley cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Bardsley playing for Sunderland in 2012]] Bardsley kept his place under new manager [[Steve Bruce]] for the first half of the [[2009–10 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2009–10 season]] until loan signing [[Alan Hutton]] took his place in February 2010. From there until the end of the campaign Bardsley was mainly used as a substitute and due his lack of playing time, Bardsley stated that he may have to consider leaving.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bardsley hints at Sunderland exit |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/low/football/teams/s/sunderland/8595617.stm |publisher=BBC News |date=30 March 2010 }}</ref> However Hutton didn't make his move permanent and Bardsley was able to reclaim his place in the side and in November 2010, he signed a new three-and-a-half-year deal running until summer 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley signs Sunderland contract extension|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/9155587.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 May 2014|date=7 November 2010}}</ref> He scored his first league goal against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 5 January 2011 with a 25-yard strike in a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9331248.stm|title=Aston Villa 0–1 Sunderland|date=5 January 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=5 January 2011}}</ref> He then scored his second of the season with another long range strike against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 1 February 2012 in a 4–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 2–4 Chelsea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9379797.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 May 2014 |date=1 February 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Phil Bardsley praises strong spirit in Sunderland squad |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/9385002.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 May 2014 |date=2 February 2011 }}</ref> He scored another long-range goal on 9 April 2011 in a 3–2 defeat against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 2–3 West Brom|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9447800.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 May 2014|date=9 April 2011}}</ref> In total Bardsley played 37 times in [[2010–11 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2010–11]] as the Black Cats finished in 10th position.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley angry at Sunderland run|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/13053350|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 May 2014}}</ref> Bardsley's consistent performances during the campaign earned him the Player of the year award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley wins supporters Player of the Year|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/phil-bardsley-wins-supporters-player-1398744|work=Chronicle Live|accessdate=31 May 2014}}</ref>
Bardsley made a poor start to the [[2011–12 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2011–12]] season as he was sent-off in a 1–0 defeat against [[Tyne–Wear derby|rivals]] [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 21 August 2011.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Sunderland 0–1 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14514549|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014}}</ref> He was then handed a retrospective four-match ban by [[The Football Association|the FA]] for an altercation [[Juan Mata]] in a 2–1 defeat by Chelsea on 10 September 2011.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland's Phil Bardsley to serve four-game FA ban|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14905428|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014|date=14 September 2011}}</ref> Despite this Bardsley retained his place in the side under [[Martin O'Neill]], playing a total of 37 matches as Sunderland finished in 13th position.<ref name="2011/12"/> He missed the start of the [[2012–13 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2012–13]] campaign after undergoing ankle surgery in August 2012.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hunter|first1=James|title=Phil Bardsley still a top Cat, declares Martin O'Neill|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/phil-bardsley-still-top-cat-1372396|website=Chronicle Live|accessdate=2 June 2014}}</ref> Bardsley returned to the side at the end of October 2012, with the team struggling near the bottom of the table.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley targets Sunderland first-team run|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20431617|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014|date=21 November 2012}}</ref> [[Paolo Di Canio]] replaced O'Neill in March 2013 and he guided the team to back to back victories over Newcastle United and Everton lifting the club away from the relegation zone.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Newcastle 0–3 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22056537|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014|date=14 April 2013}}</ref> Bardsley scored in the penultimate match of the season in a 1–1 draw with [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 12 May 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 1–1 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22417765|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014}}</ref> Bardsley missed the final match of the season away at [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] after he and [[Matthew Kilgallon]] were pictured visiting a casino, angering Di Canio who vowed never to play the pair again.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2326902/Phil-Bardsley-pictured-lying-50-notes-casino-floor.html |location=London |work=Daily Mail |title=Bardsley pictured on casino floor in pile of £50 notes... leaving strict Sunderland boss Di Canio furious }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=You'll NEVER play for me again! Di Canio lays into Bardsley after shamed Sunderland star poses with £50 notes in casino... and you can read the Italian's amazing 24-minute rant right here |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2327252/Paolo-Di-Canio-says-Phil-Bardsley-play-Sunderland-again.html |work=Daily Mail |location=London }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Paolo Di Canio says misbehaving Sunderland players will leave|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22590459|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014}}</ref> Di Canio also fined Bardsley as well as six other Sunderland players for "indiscipline" which prompted an investigation by [[Professional Footballers' Association|the PFA]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Sanghera|first1=Mandeep|title=Paolo Di Canio: PFA investigates decision to fine Sunderland players|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22608572|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2014|date=21 May 2013}}</ref>
Bardsley began the [[2013–14 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2013–14]] season playing with the under-21s and whilst playing against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] on 12 August 2013 he broke his foot ending Di Canio's attempts to sell him.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland defender Phil Bardsley faces 10 weeks out through injury|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11695/8868332/sunderland-defender-phil-bardsley-faces-10-weeks-out-through-injury|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=3 June 2014}}</ref> On 20 August 2013, Bardsley was suspended by Sunderland after mocking the club's opening day defeat to Fulham on a social media site.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland suspended Bardsley for mocking Twitter post|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/231487.html|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=22 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland: Phil Bardsley suspended amid investigation|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23768404|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014|date=20 August 2013}}</ref> His suspension was lifted on 4 September 2013 after he apologised.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley: Sunderland lift suspension after he apologises|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23962761|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014|date=4 September 2013}}</ref> Di Canio was sacked and replaced by [[Gus Poyet]] in October 2013 and brought Bardsley back into the first-team.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley set to make his Sunderland return at Swansea|url=http://www.thejournal.co.uk/sport/phil-bardsley-set-make-sunderland-6177479|website=The Journal|accessdate=3 June 2014}}</ref> He made a poor start on his return, scoring an own goal in a 4–0 defeat away at [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Swansea 4–0 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24503990|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014|date=19 October 2013}}</ref> His form improved thereafter scoring against Southampton in the League Cup and the only goal in a 1–0 win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 10 November 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 1–0 Man City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24792966|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014|date=10 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland's Phil Bardsley trying to regain fans' trust|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24897725|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014|date=11 November 2013}}</ref> He scored against his former club Manchester United in the 2nd leg of the League Cup semi-final as Sunderland progressed to the final on penalties.<ref>{{cite web|title=Man Utd 2–1 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25740123|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014|date=22 January 2014}}</ref> Bardsley played the full match of the [[2014 Football League Cup Final]] as Sunderland lost 3–1 to Manchester City.<ref>{{cite web|title=Man City 3–1 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26311649|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 June 2014}}</ref> Bardsley played a total of 33 times in 2013–14 as Sunderland finished in 14th position.<ref name="2013/14"/>
===Stoke City=== With Bardsley's Sunderland contract due to expire at the end of June 2014, other clubs were free to approach him from January 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bardsley's future is still unclear|url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/football/11167438.Bardsley_s_future_is_still_unclear/|website=Daily Echo|accessdate=11 March 2015}}</ref> On 22 May 2014, Bardsley signed a three-year contract with [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Potters Complete Bardsley Signing |url=http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/potters-complete-bardsley-signing-1570484.aspx |publisher=stokecityfc.com (Stoke City FC) |date=22 May 2014 |accessdate=22 May 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke sign Phil Bardsley from Sunderland on three-year deal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27529040|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2015}}</ref> He made his Premier League debut for Stoke on the opening day of the [[2014–15 Stoke City F.C. season|2014–15]] season in a 1–0 defeat against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 0–1 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718337|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2015}}</ref> Bardsley established himself as a regular under [[Mark Hughes]] but struggled with discipline, picking up nine yellow cards by March 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley cool on yellow peril ahead of Albion trip|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Phil-Bardsley-cool-yellow-peril-ahead/story-26141659-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=11 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150313132751/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Phil-Bardsley-cool-yellow-peril-ahead/story-26141659-detail/story.html|archivedate=13 March 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Bardsley played 30 times for Stoke in the 2014–15 season as Stoke finished in 9th position.<ref name="2014/15"/>
Bardsley lost his place in the Stoke squad for the [[2015–16 Stoke City F.C. season|2015–16]] season following the arrival of [[Glen Johnson (English footballer)|Glen Johnson]] from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite web|title=I've got no plans to leave says Phil Bardsley|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-ve-got-plans-leave-says-Phil-Bardsley/story-28236778-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=2 December 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151128084225/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-ve-got-plans-leave-says-Phil-Bardsley/story-28236778-detail/story.html|archivedate=28 November 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Despite missing out on league appearances Bardsley played a part in Stoke's [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] campaign. He was sent-off in the fourth round against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and scored a 30-yard free kick in the quarter final victory over [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 1–1 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34577998|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2–0 Sheff Wed|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34907303|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 December 2015}}</ref> Following injury to Johnson in February, Bardsley took his place back in the side until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley insists rival Glen Johnson is still his big mate|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Phil-Bardsley-insists-rival-Glen/story-28986545-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=23 May 2016}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He made 17 appearances for Stoke in 2015–16 as Stoke again finished in 9th position.<ref name="2015/16"/>
Bardsley scored a rare goal in a 4–0 [[EFL Cup]] victory over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] on 23 August 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stevenage 0–4 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37091171|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref> He suffered a knee injury on November which ruled him out for three months.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke City: Phil Bardsley expected to be out until the New Year|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/stoke-city-phil-bardsley-expected-to-be-out-until-the-new-year/story-29927298-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=23 May 2017}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He returned to the side in February but after getting sent-off against Chelsea on 18 March 2017 he was unable to get back into the team.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 1–2 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39240187|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref> Speaking in April 2017 Bardsley revealed that he is in limbo over whether he will be offered a new contract.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley in limbo over Stoke City contract|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/phil-bardsley-in-limbo-over-stoke-city-contract/story-30264035-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=23 May 2017}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Bardsley played 16 times in [[2016–17 Stoke City F.C. season|2016–17]] as Stoke finished in 13th position.<ref name="2016/17"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2016/17 Premier League season review|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11701/10887143/stoke-201617-premier-league-season-review|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=22 May 2017}}</ref> He signed a contract extension with Stoke on 26 May 2017.<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley signs up for another year at Stoke City|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/phil-bardsley-signs-up-for-another-year-at-stoke-city/story-30355653-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=26 May 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170526124139/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/phil-bardsley-signs-up-for-another-year-at-stoke-city/story-30355653-detail/story.html|archivedate=26 May 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Burnley=== On 25 July 2017, Bardsley completed a transfer to Premier League club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], signing a two-year contract.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/2017/july/clarets-make-bardsley-fourth-summer-signing/|title=Clarets Make Bardsley Fourth Summer Signing|publisher=Burnley Official Site|date=25 July 2017}}</ref>
==International career== On 6 October 2010, Bardsley received a call-up for the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] national team for the [[Euro 2012 Qualifiers|Euro 2012 qualifier]] against the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] on 8 October 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/scotland/9059609.stm |title=Sunderland's Phil Bardsley called in to Scots squad |publisher=BBC News |first=Clive |last=Lindsay |date=8 October 2010}}</ref> He qualifies because his father was born in Glasgow.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article601171.ece|title=Phil Good Factor |location=London |work=The Times |first=Simon |last=Buckland |date=15 October 2006}}</ref> He made his debut on 11 October 2010 in a 3–2 defeat by World and European champions [[Spain national football team|Spain]], filling in for the injured [[Alan Hutton]].
==Style of play== Bardsley plays at [[right back]] and describes himself as a modern full-back.— "Since I started playing professionally, the game has changed and you have to be really, really fit because a full-back is expected to get up and down the pitch. I like to defend and be aggressive, but also get forward to create chances and create goals, it's all part of being a modern-day full-back."<ref>{{cite web|title=Phil Bardsley ready to win over new fans|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Phil-Bardsley-ready-win-new-fans/story-22082420-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=11 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402111820/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Phil-Bardsley-ready-win-new-fans/story-22082420-detail/story.html|archivedate=2 April 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Coaching career== In May 2017, Bardsley took a [[UEFA B Licence]] course with the [[Irish Football Association]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Video: Stoke defender Phil Bardsley looks after his long-term future at the UEFA B License course|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/video-news/video-stoke-defender-phil-bardsley-looks-after-his-longterm-future-at-the-uefa-b-license-course-35754773.html|website=The Belfast Telegraph|accessdate=25 May 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Bardsley married glamour model [[Tanya Robinson]] in 2014, with whom he has three children.<ref>{{cite web|title=Wife of Scotland football star Phil Bardsley reveals how she was sexually assaulted in hotel by worker|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/wife-scotland-football-star-phil-4975273|website=Daily Record|accessdate=11 March 2015}}</ref> Bardsley's grandfather, John Lancaster, died in a car crash in October 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Former Manchester United footballer Phil Bardsley 'inconsolable' after grandfather dies in a car crash|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/greater-manchester-news/footballer-phil-bardsley-inconsolable-after-12077468|last=Bourne|first=Dianne|date=25 October 2016|website=Manchester Evening News|accessdate=25 October 2016}}</ref>
